data.text: @FlyOpineMonkey Yes and those considered (amongst) the best ever at what they did. I won’t be drawn into churlish nit-picking over this.
@tradrmum It is a universally acknowledged truth that national honours go to Captains of the Aussie XI .
@tradrmum Warnie getting a state funeral? I did not think he captained the Aussie XI!
@stbayside And if he does I will criticise him alongside you. Until then, the focus shouldn’t be about him.

@tradrmum Whatever the protocol (and don't talk down to me), Andrews will spin this for his own political purpose. Whenever Vic Labor govt doing badly, he trots out one announcement after another. He really is a ghoul. The sooner he's out of State govt the better for all Victorians

@stbayside It’s quite clear you are unfamiliar with the usual protocols in these situations. The PM’s statement clearly said arrangements would be made in accordance with the wishes of family & State. It’s highly unusual for Commonwealth funerals for people outside of politics. Highly.
@tradrmum PM offered the Cth/ State funeral, it's not for Andrews to do so. He really needs to stop thinking  he's the PM. He's not. And he'll be gone in November
@stbayside Sorry? Who do you think grants State Funerals? This is not about Andrews as a person, it’s about the office he occupies (for now).

@tradrmum It's not for him to do so. Warne is a national icon. Andrews needs to know his place - he's a silly little tinpot Premier who thinks he's the PM, or a "statesman". He's an inept corrupt man, who's ruined the lives of Victorians. He doesn't deserve anyone's respect
